headline: Ohio to spend $10.5 million on ballistics tracing machines
author: Associated Press
sentences: COLUMBUS â€” State leaders on Thursday announced plans to spend $10.5 million on additional machines used to trace ballistic evidence from gun crimes.
The units analyze microscopic markings on bullets and shell casings and compare them to similar evidence from other gun crimes.
The spending increases from nine to 16 the number of Ohio National Integrated Ballistic Information Network units.
